text: in India cows are sacred animals they
are worshipped not slaughtered resulting
in a massive number of free-ranging cows
283 million to be exact it's actually
bizarre and unexplainable how many cows
are walking around this country dude you
almost just got hit by a cow as I was
expelling that like that was kind of
scary I was just scared and was like if
India's cattle were counted as a human
population it'd be the fourth most
populous country in the world behind the
USA even crazier about seven million
cows are completely homeless that's like
the population of Arizona wandering the
streets without food or shelter India
stray cows are seen blocking streets
causing accidents destroying fields and
even worse spreading diseases because
they eat garbage which contaminate their
milk so here we just have a street food
vendor and a cow that's eating the trash
right next to it illegal dairies across
big cities are selling this cheap
polluted milk to the poor population
which can be lethal
so why are there so many cows in India
the answer revolves around religion
Mahatma Gandhi once said that the
central fact of Hinduism is cow
protection and Hinduism is practiced by
about 80 percent of Indians or roughly
1.1 billion people as a result most
states in India prohibit cow slaughter
and ban the consumption of beef so
instead of eating hamburgers which
aren't even sold at any McDonald's
across India the cows are worshipped on
temples and decorated during festivals
another reason for the high number of
cows is because farmers are increasingly
turning them loose when they can't
afford to feed them or they get too old
and become useless to me it seems like a
never-ending cycle and I can only
imagine the cow population continuing to
grow unless the government decides to do
something about it I'm drew pinsky and
if you like my travel videos please
click Subscribe and join me as I plan to
visit every country in the world
